    • run

      public boolean run(String input) throws StateExistsException, WrongAlphabetException
      Runs automata on word and returns true if automata accept given word. Complexity: O(n) - linear in characters of input
      Specified by:
      run in class Fa
      Parameters:
      input - string on which will automata be executed
      Returns:
      true if automata accept word
      Throws:
      StateExistsException - if automaton goes to non-existing state for unsupported symbol
      WrongAlphabetException

    • stateName

      public String stateName(Set<DfaState> states)
      Forms a state name from multiple states. Complexity: O(n) - linear of states passed as parameter
      Parameters:
      states - set of states from which new state name will be made
      Returns:
      new state name

    • finalStates

      public Vector<DfaState> finalStates()
      Finds and returns all final states of automaton. Complexity: O(n) - linear of states
      Returns:
      vector of final states

    • minimize

      public Dfa minimize() throws StateExistsException
      Minimizes dfa by removing its unreachable states and combining those non-distinguishable. Complexity: O(m * n * k) - nonDistinguishableStates() NonDistinguishableStates}
      Returns:
      minimized DFA
      Throws:
      StateExistsException

    • validAutomata

      public boolean validAutomata()
      Checks if every state has transition for every symbol of the alphabet. Complexity: linear in number of states - O(n)
      Returns:
      true if every state has all transitions

    • getAlphabet

      public List<Character> getAlphabet()
      Finds the alphabet of the given automaton.
      Returns:
      list of symbols used in alphabet of automaton

    • union

      public Dfa union(Dfa other) throws StateExistsException
      Creates the union of two automata and returns new automaton (no side effects). Complexity: O(n * m * k) - CreateProduct
      Parameters:
      other - second operand automaton
      Returns:
      automaton that is union of two automatas
      Throws:
      StateExistsException - if the state doesn't exist

    • intersection

      public Dfa intersection(Dfa other) throws StateExistsException
      Creates the intersection of two automata and returns new automaton (no side effects). Complexity: O(n * m * k) - CreateProduct
      Parameters:
      other - second operand automaton
      Returns:
      automaton that is intersection of two automatas
      Throws:
      StateExistsException - if the state doesn't exist

    • difference

      public Dfa difference(Dfa other) throws StateExistsException
      Creates the difference of two automata and returns new automaton (no side effects). Complexity: O(n * m * k) - CreateProduct
      Parameters:
      other - second operand automaton
      Returns:
      automaton that is difference of two automatas
      Throws:
      StateExistsException - if the state doesn't exist

    • complement

      public Dfa complement()
      Does the logical negation of each state. Final states become non-final and vice versa (no side effects). Complexity: O(n * m) where n is number of states and m is number of transitions of that state
      Returns:
      new automaton that has inverted value of final state

    • concatenation

      public Dfa concatenation(Dfa other) throws StateExistsException
      Concatenates two automata by transforming them to NFAs and adding epsilon transition from final states of first automaton to beginning state of second automaton (no side effects). Final states of first automaton become non-final. Concatenation
      Parameters:
      other - second operand automaton
      Returns:
      automaton that is concatenation of two automata
      Throws:
      StateExistsException - if the state doesn't exist

    • kleeneStar

      public Nfa kleeneStar()
      Does the Kleene operation on automaton (no side effects). Complexity: O(n * m) where n is number of states and m is cardinality of alphabet
      Returns:
      NFA automaton that accepts Kleene star (zero or more concatenated repetitions) in the language of the given automaton.

    • shortestWord

      public int shortestWord() throws StateExistsException, WordLengthException
      Finds a length of the shortest word accepted by automaton. Does the BFS Complexity: O(n^2 * m) where n is number of states and m is cardinality of alphabet search until it comes to a first final state.
      Returns:
      length of the shortest word accepted by automaton
      Throws:
      StateExistsException - if the state doesn't exist
      WordLengthException - if the automaton doesn't accept any word

    • longestWord

      public int longestWord() throws StateExistsException, WordLengthException
      Checks if automaton is finite and finds the longest word accepted by automaton. Complexity: O(n*m*k) - minimize() Minimize}
      Returns:
      length of the shortest word accepted by automaton
      Throws:
      StateExistsException - if the state doesn't exist
      WordLengthException - if automaton is not finite

    • equivalent

      public boolean equivalent(Object o) throws StateExistsException
      Checks if two automatons are equivalent Complexity: O(n*m*k) - minimize() Minimize}
      Parameters:
      o - other automaton
      Returns:
      true if they're equivalent
      Throws:
      StateExistsException - if the state doesn't exist
